quote: What can I get for you?
A Til'amin froth for me.
Romulan ale.
A glass of springwine.
Since when do you drink   springwine -- or anything else,   for that matter?
It's for Kira. She should be   getting out of services any   minute.
Here she is.
How was it?
Beautiful.
Ranjen Telna gave a very moving   sermon.
What was it about?
How important it is to be able to   forgive people who've wronged us.
Two hours on forgiveness?
It's a big subject.
What's wrong?
Nothing. It's just... you spend   so much time in services.   Sometimes it makes me wish I was   a believer so we could go   together.
That's so sweet...
I'd love for you to come, but you   wouldn't get much out of it if   you don't believe in the   Prophets.
Maybe if I had an Orb   experience... ?
That's not the way it works.   Faith has to come first.
Too bad. I have a feeling it   must be very... comforting to   believe in something more   powerful than yourself.
If you really feel that way,   there are other faiths.
Would it bother you if Odo became   a believer in...       -- Klingon religion?
Not as long as he gets something   out of it.
He'd get to eat the hearts of his   enemies.
And go to Sto'Vo'Kor when he   dies.
But I wouldn't get to go to   services with Kira, would I? And   that's the whole point.
(unaccountably    moved)   That really is so sweet...
Yes.
(surprised and glad    to see him)   Vedek Fala...
Nerys.
I can't believe it. What are you   doing here?
I came to see you.
Come in, sit down. Let me get   you some tea.
I contacted the University a few   months ago -- they said you were   on some sort of spiritual retreat?
You know me -- always searching   for answers.
That's what makes you different   from other vedeks I've known.   For you, Faith is a journey.
One that never ends...
So you're a colonel now...       It seems like only yesterday you   were just a little girl,   squirming in her chair during   instruction.
(smiling as she    corrects him)   There were no chairs in the camp --   we sat on the floor.
Which was good for discipline --   it made me seem more imposing.
As if you needed help.    (in a stern teachers    voice)   "Nerys, what are the three keys   to enlightenment?"
And the answer?
Charity, humility and faith.
You remember.
You were a good teacher. Without   you, I'm not sure I would've   survived that camp.
I brought you something.
What is it?
Welcome to Empok Nor...
Empok Nor? That's impossible.
I know it's a long way from Deep   Space Nine --       This transponder allowed us to   beam you here.
Those armbands... you belong to   the cult of the Pah-wraiths...
We worship the True Prophets,   yes.
Why did you bring me here?
That's a question best answered   by the Master.
And who, exactly, is "The   Master?"
I am.
Dukat... ?
You -- you're the leader of the   Pah-wraith cult?
I'm sure you have many questions,   Nerys, and I intend to answer   them all.
Leave us, please.
First of all, let me apologize   for bringing you here without   your permission.
It's all right, I've always   wanted to see Empok Nor.       Is the Dominion aware you've set   up a... "temple" here?
The station has been abandoned a   long time. They have no reason   to object to our making use of   it.
Your hair... you changed it.
Your ear... you pierced it.
(touching the    dangling chain)   A symbol of the Covenant I've   made with my new family...
Your new family...       Well, I guess it makes sense that   these people would choose you as   their leader -- they worship   evil.
The Pah-wraiths aren't what you   think. And neither am I.

Let me ask you something. Have   you ever wondered why the   Prophets stood by and did nothing   when the Cardassians took over   Bajor? Have you ever asked   yourself why they would allow   your people to suffer?
The Prophets have a plan for us --   but it's not always easy to see   what it is.

Even as you say those words, you   must know how hollow they sound.   There's a better explanation.   One that makes perfect sense.       The Prophets aren't the true gods   of Bajor, the Pah-wraiths are.

They were cast from the Celestial   Temple because they wanted to   take an active role in Bajoran   life. Their only crime was that   they cared about your people.   But they weren't allowed to help   you because they lost the battle   for heaven and were forced to   flee.
I guess the Ancient Texts have it   all wrong, then.
We both know that history is   always written by the victors.   But rest assured, there'll be   another chapter.
The Pah-wraiths are determined to   regain their place in heaven.
And how would you know that?
They speak to me in visions.       I am their Emissary.
I don't know if you believe what   you're saying, if you're faking   it, or if you're just insane.
I was touched by the hand of a   god. I'm a changed man.

Oh, I admit, when I allowed   myself to become a vessel for the   Pah-wraith, I did it for self-   serving reasons. I wanted to   help it enter the wormhole so it   could force the Prophets out. It   was nothing more than a way to   exact vengeance on Sisko.       But I had no idea the effect it   would have on me. It was only   inside me for a short time, but   it opened my heart.
Would that be before or after you   killed Jadzia?
That was most unfortunate, but it   couldn't be helped. The   Celestial Temple itself was at   stake, and she was in the way.

Nerys, I wish I had the words to   describe what it was like to have   the Pah-wraith within me. I   could feel its love -- for me,   and for the Bajoran people. it   made me realize that I still had   a role to play in Bajor's   destiny.
You mean besides overseeing an   occupation that killed tens of   millions?
You have no idea how much it   pains me to know that I caused so   much suffering. But I'm not   responsible for the Occupation,   the Prophets are.
You have no right to say that.
They abandoned Bajor. I was only   walking the path they laid down   for me.       Now I walk with the true   Prophets.
I'm building a community here,   Nerys. I brought these people to   Empok Nor so we could purify   ourselves in preparation for the   day the Pah-wraiths reclaim the   Celestial Temple.
And what's supposed to happen   when that day comes?
The Pah-wraiths have a plan for   Bajor. When the time is right,   they'll reveal it to me.
Something tells me their plan is   going to involve you becoming   ruler of Bajor again.

You're still so full of anger   toward me. I can only hope that   in time, you'll let it go. I   brought you here because I want   you to be part of our community.   I want you to share in the love   these people have for each other --   in the love they have for me.
These people don't love you.   You have some kind of hold over   them, but love?
Open your heart to me, Nerys.       We're bound together by destiny.   You belong at my side.
When did you realize she was   missing?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: This morning -- she usually comes   by my office before she goes to   Ops.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Did you check the entry log?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: She had a visitor a little after   nineteen hundred hours. Whoever   it was only stayed about ten   minutes.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Anything?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: According to the Ops report, only   one ship has left the station   since last night -- the morning   transport to Bajor.       Kira was not aboard.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Sir, I'm picking up traces of   tachyon energy.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: A transporter beam?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: With a Dominion signature.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Is there any way to trace it?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Afraid not, the signal's already   dissipated.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Their transporters operate over   longer distances than ours --   what's their maximum range?
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: If a homing transponder is in   place, up to three light years.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: There was a homing transponder,   all right.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: It was wrapped inside this.
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: Three light years... for all we   know, she could be deep inside   Dominion space by now...
scene: 8    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - KIRA'S QUARTERS

quote: I had a feeling you'd turn up   sooner of later.
I know you're angry with me --
Angry? I feel sorry for you.   Letting yourself be duped by   Dukat into joining this cult.
I was a member of this "cult," as   you call it, long before Dukat.
I came to it toward the end of   the Occupation. It's helped me   make sense of the suffering we   all had to endure.
In the camp, you kept us together   -- it was your faith in the   Prophets that got us through. I   can't believe that you -- of all   people -- would turn your back on   them.
They turned their backs on us   long ago.
The path they've laid out for us   may not be easy, but that's no   reason to turn to hate and fear.
"Hate and fear" -- do you know   how often I've heard those words   used to describe us? Nothing   could be further from the truth.
The Pah-wraith cult tried to kill   the Emissary.
Dukat had nothing to do with   that. The boy who attacked   Captain Sisko was acting out of   his own misguided beliefs.
We're peaceful people.
Prove it. Let me go.
Nerys, the Master brought you   here because he cares about your   spiritual well-being.
The "Master" -- he's using you.   He's taking your beliefs and   twisting them to suit his own   purposes.
You're so stubborn -- that's   always been your problem.
Your problem is that you've   always been too trusting.
When Dukat first came to us, I   didn't want to accept him. But I   came to realize that the    Pah-wraiths had taken this man of   evil and washed him clean. What   could be more wondrous than that?
How can you forget all the   friends we lost during the   Occupation? How can you forget   the millions Dukat murdered?
You disappoint me. Of all the   things I tried to teach you, the   most important was the need to   forgive.
There are some things that can't   be forgiven.
Nerys, let me show you how we   live. I want you to see the   community we're building here so   that you'll know that you have   nothing to fear from Dukat -- or   from us.
-- only one of the fusion   generators is operational, so we   don't have power for things like   replicators.
Where do you get your food?
We've turned several of the lower   levels into hydroponic bays.
What about things like medical   supplies -- do you bring them   from Bajor?
We have a few cargo shuttles.       We're well aware that you might   try to leave us. You should know   that the docking bays are being   guarded. As is the transporter   we used to bring you here.
As long as we're on the subject,   am I free to move around, talk to   people?
Of course. It's the Master's   hope that you'll come to see this   as your home.
Mika, this is Nerys.
Welcome.
You're getting close.
It could be any time now.
Mika and her husband have the   honor of being the first to   receive the Master's blessing to   bear children.
You need Dukat's permission to   have a baby?
Vows of abstinence are part of   our Covenant with him.   Exceptions are granted only when   he sees that a wife and her   husband have demonstrated a true   spiritual bond.
I see...
You don't approve.       In ancient times, Bajorans   understood the value of denying   worldly pleasures.       Ironic, isn't it, that a   Cardassian would lead us back to   the old ways?
Especially a Cardassian who's   appetite for worldly pleasures is   legendary.
That was a long time ago, before   he felt the kiss of the    Pah-wraith.
Must've been some kiss.
Striking, isn't it?
Benyan is Mika's husband.
Congratulations.       I understand it isn't easy to   get... permission to have a baby.
The Master told us you wouldn't   approve of our ways. He said we   should be patient with you.
Don't go out of your way.
I don't understand why he brought   you here.
Benyan --
No, it's all right.
We've all worked hard for what we   have. We don't need you or   anyone else to approve of us.
Fair enough.
Don't misunderstand. I hope you   come to feel the love of the    Pah-wraiths. But if you don't...   that's your loss.       No offense.
None taken. In fact, I've always   found that people who try to   convince others of their beliefs   are usually trying to convince   themselves.
I know what I believe.
That's what scares me.       No offense.
-- ba'ja kor'ek, no'la ba'lani,   pah'nom ko'se plusso ma'kora.   Ba'ja kor'ek, no'la ba'lani,   pah'nom ko'se plusso ma'kora.
Kosst no'valt Amojan, my   children. (The love of the Pah-   wraiths be with you.)
Kosst no'valt Amojan.
Let us open our hearts and pray.
Ba'ja kor'ek, no'la ba'lani,   pah'nom ko'se plusso ma'kora.   Ba'ja kor'ek, no'la ba'lani,   pah'nom ko'se plusso ma'kora.
Don't.
Dukat.
Stay where you are.
The rest of you -- get down on   the floor.
I said on the floor.
Move aside.
No.
Enough, Nerys, unless you're   willing to kill us all.
Now do you understand how much   they love me... ?
Careful, no sudden moves.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: (indicating her    JACKET lying    nearby)   I removed it so I could tend to   your bruise.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: (indicating a nearby    TRAY)   I had a meal prepared for you.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: I'm not hungry.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Go ahead, you haven't eaten since   you arrived.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: I know what you're thinking. But   really, what good would it do to   try to kill me? Even if you   succeeded, it wouldn't get you   off Empok Nor. You'd only be   making me a martyr.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: If it wasn't for me, the   occupation would've been much   worse.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: And you want a thank you?       You were working people to death   in the ore processing centers,   but that didn't stop you from   strutting around Terok Nor,   picking out Bajoran women to take   to your bed. And actually   believing they wanted to be   there.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Your mother wanted to be there.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: You took her away from her   children. She did what she had   to in order to make sure we   survived.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: She loved me.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Maybe she convinced herself she   did -- and that's a very   different thing.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Perhaps you're right. And if I   caused your mother any pain, I   regret it.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Just as I regret many other   things I did in those years.   Thankfully, the Pah-wraiths have   given me an opportunity to redeem   myself in the eyes of your   people.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: How? By recreating some   idealized version of the   Occupation? Because that's   exactly what you're doing here.   You have your station back,   Bajorans to serve your every   whim. And the best part is, this   time they really do love you. As   misguided as it is, they love   you.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: I'm so glad you're here, Nerys.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: You embody everything I admire   most about the Bajoran people.   Your passion, your spirit. I see   now why the Pah-wraiths want you   at my side.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: And why's that?
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Because if I can open your heart   to them, then surely I can open   the heart of any Bajoran.       Yes, your anger is a challenge.   But I welcome it. Because in the   end, it will help me better serve   the Pah-wraiths.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Yes.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: It's Mika. She's gone into   labor.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: Come, Nerys. I want you to be a   witness to this blessed event.
scene: 20   INT. EMPOK NOR - DUKAT'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON KIRA

quote: I've been told Mika is on her way   out. This is a great day for us,   Benyan. You should be honored to   have fathered the first child   born to our community.
The Pah-wraiths... they've sent   us a sign...

My children, something wondrous   has happened. This infant --   born of the love between Benyan   and Mika -- was transformed in   her womb into a living symbol of   the Covenant I've made with you.       What a blessed day this is --   there can no longer be any doubt   that the Pah-wraiths are smiling   upon us.
Let us give thanks and praise.
Ka'li bor'ek, no'ma ten'su, fah-   jah nori bentu'sa. Ka'li bor'ek,   no'ma ten'su, fah-jah nori   bentu'sa.
You're an intelligent man. How   can you believe Dukat's story?   It's obvious he's the baby's   father.
What's obvious is that you hate   him so much, you can't even   entertain the possibility that a   miracle occurred.
Are you so blind you'll believe   anything he says?

I have faith. I would think   you'd understand what that means.       Nerys, is it so beyond the realm   of possibility that the Pah-   wraiths sent that child to us as   a sign? They have powers beyond   our understanding. Your Prophets   made an entire fleet of Dominion   ships vanish into thin air!   What's one child compared to a   miracle like that?

You know what the miracle was?   That Mika was able to keep from   breaking into tears in front of   her husband. She was terrified   he wouldn't believe Dukat's   little performance. I could see   it in her eyes.
You saw what you wanted to see.
If you really believe it was a   miracle, then you won't mind if I   talk to the happy couple.
What's wrong? Are you afraid to   find out the truth?
I know the truth. I just don't   want you making unfounded   accusations.
I'll be discreet.
It's coming along nicely...
Maybe you should make one of the   children half-Cardassian?
To commemorate what's happened.
If I'd known, I would've.
(neutral but    leading)   It must be quite an honor to be   part of such a miraculous   event...
It is.
Obviously Dukat did the right   thing when he gave you permission   to have a baby.
We prayed together many times...   he wanted to be sure.
Did you ever pray with him alone?
Yes.
Did Mika?
Yes.
Nerys, we should let Benyan get   back to work.
You saw his face.
He was angry -- he knew what you   were implying.
There's Mika.
When we find her, I trust you'll   be more discreet than you were   with Benyan.
I'm sorry.
Why didn't you tell me the baby   was mine?
I didn't know. I was hoping it   wasn't.
Mika, I'm so sorry about what   happened that night. I was   weak... and you were so   beautiful.
I've forgiven you. You know   that.
Have you told anyone?
No...
Not even Benyan?
He wants to believe it was a   miracle, but I know he has   doubts. If he ever asks me, I   don't know if I can lie to him.
He says he saw her come this way.
Don't worry, everything's going   to be all right...
Wait here until I'm gone, then go   back to you quarters and pray for   strength.
Mika?
Mika.
You got to her just in time.
How is she?
The depressurization caused   swelling in her meningeal tissues   -- I'm going to keep her sedated   until morning.
But she's going to recover?
She'll be fine.
Seal the docking ring and have   all the airlocks inspected --    let's make sure we never have   another accident like this.
Accident?
What happened, Dukat? Was she   going to tell everyone that   you're the father of her child?
Kira --
Is that why you tried to kill   her?
Enough.
It's all right, Fala. Nerys is   obviously upset. She doesn't   know what she's saying.
Mika won't lie for you anymore.
Take her to her quarters. She   needs to rest.
Don't let him near her --
Let us pray for Mika's recovery.
Ka'la mo'sek, teru-benso, Kosst   Amojan golis rej.

I failed you. Forgive my   weakness. Forgive me for letting   temptation obscure the path   you've laid out for me.       When Mika awakes -- and I pray   she does -- your children will   learn the truth.       They'll turn away from me...   they'll turn away from you. The   Covenant will be broken. Don't   let that happen. Tell me what to   do. Please.
It's not time for services...
I'll stay with her if you want to   go.
You go.
Kosst no'valt Amojan, my   children.
Kosst no'valt Amojan.
Tonight, while I prayed, the Pah-   wraiths sent me a vision.
They told me it was the last I'd   ever receive from them.
There's a reason for this... a   wondrous reason.
My children, the Pah-wraiths have   asked us to join them in their   Holy quest to reclaim the   Celestial Temple.
To become warriors in this great   battle, we must transform   ourselves... our corporeal bodies   are not suitable for the task   ahead... so we must leave them   behind.
In a few hours, at the start of   the new day, we'll gather   together here for the last time.   We will shed the flesh that ties   us to this world...
And deliver ourselves into the   waiting arms of the Pah-   wraiths...
Ka'li bor'ek, no'ma ten'su, fah-   jah nori bentu'sa.
Ka'li bor'ek, no'ma ten'su, fah-   jah nori bentu'sa.
I sent a message to Deep Space   Nine. They should be able to get   someone here for you within a day   or so.
I know you're desperate to keep   your followers from turning   against you. It doesn't surprise   me that you're willing to kill   them. But I can't believe you're   willing to die yourself.
You don't understand, Nerys.
The Pah-wraiths are calling me   home. You should be happy.
Happy? Fifty people are going to   die.
I assure you, our deaths will be   painless.

Promazine. It was developed by   the Obsidian Order for its   operatives to use in case of   capture. Not only is death   swift, it reduces the body to   dust within hours, making it   unidentifiable to the enemy.       Dust... that's all that'll be   left of my passage through this   misbegotten universe. But it   doesn't bother me. Because I   know that I'm going to be with   the Pah-wraiths.
You really believe that.
Good-bye, Nerys.
My children, the time has come   for us to leave this world   behind...
-- as we embark on this journey,   our hearts are not heavy, but   joyful. Because we know we'll be   together in the holy light of the   Pah-wraiths.
This is a great day for us...
scene: 67DD INT. EMPOK NOR - PROMENADE - SECOND LEVEL

quote: We have proven ourselves worthy of   them. They're calling us home.
This is the means of our   deliverance...
Kosst no'valt Amojan, my   children.
Kosst no'valt Amojan.
Don't be afraid... I love you   all...
Dukat.
Don't you see why he's doing   this?
He doesn't want you to find out   the truth!
Are you all right?
Everyone, please. Let's not   allow anything to disrupt this   holy moment.
What's wrong, Dukat? Take it.
Go ahead. They're all the same,   aren't they?
My children, listen to me.
Tell them, Dukat -- tell them you   never had any intention of dying   with them.
My time here is not finished.
The Pah-wraiths want me to   continue bringing others into   their light.
This is your child, isn't it?   That's why you tried to kill   Mika.
(desperate to    explain)   The Pah-wraiths have forgiven my   sins. They've given me their   absolution.
Who are you to presume they're   wrong? Who are you to judge me?
Then it's done. Our Covenant is   broken.
None of you will ever know the   love of the Pah-wraiths. None of   you!
Fala, no.
Why?
Faith, Nerys. Faith...
I'm sorry about Vedek Fala...
I keep going over what he said   when he died. I don't know if he   was trying to tell me that he   never lost his faith... or that   he felt betrayed by it.
I suppose you'll never know...       One thing's for certain, these   people were betrayed. And now   they have to find a way to pick   up the pieces and move on.
I thought Dukat was just claiming   to share their faith because he   wanted them to love him.       But it was more than that. He's   changed.
Has he? If you hadn't stopped   him, he would've killed them all,   and no one would've known that   his body wasn't among the   remains. That sounds like the   same old Dukat to me.
I know this is going to sound   crazy... but I think he convinced   himself that he was doing what   the Pah-wraiths wanted.
Who knows, maybe he was.
Either way, he believes. And   that makes him more dangerous   than ever...
